abstract: Deaths of police officers in Houston and in northern Colorado have brought renewed scrutiny of spike strips, tool commonly used by law enforcement to flatten tires of fleeing vehicle to end high-speed chase; officers deploying strips, as well as pedestrians and other motorists, are often put in danger by out-of-control disabled vehicles or drivers who deliberately swerve to avoid spikes.
lead_paragraph: At least 30 people have been killed in the two decades since spike strips became popular, some run over by drivers trying to evade capture at any cost.

headline.main: Officers’ Deaths Revive Concerns Over Dangers of Spike Strips
headline.print_headline: Officers’ Deaths Revive Concerns About Dangers of Deploying Spike Strips
